title: Eresia lansdorfi
text:
Eresia lansdorfi, the false erato or Lansdorf's crescent, is a <a href="butterfly">butterfly</a> of the family <a href="Nymphalidae">Nymphalidae</a>.
Description.
"Eresia lansdorfi" has a wingspan of about . The upperside of the wings is black. The forewings have a yellowish basal stripe, while the postdiscal area is light red brown, including the costal bar. The hindwings have a pale yellow transverse band.
This medium-sized species imitates (<a href="Batesian%20mimicry">Batesian mimicry</a>) two local subspecies of "<a href="Heliconius%20erato">Heliconius erato</a>" (hence the common name) and "<a href="Heliconius%20melpomene">Heliconius melpomene</a>".
Larvae feed on "<a href="Ruellia%20brevifolia">Ruellia brevifolia</a>".
Distribution.
This species can be found in <a href="Brazil">Brazil</a>, Northern <a href="Argentina">Argentina</a>, <a href="Paraguay">Paraguay</a>, <a href="Uruguay">Uruguay</a> and <a href="Peru">Peru</a>.
